body_html:
It has, but one thing I realize I haven't documented well is passing in optimization flags to the build process. After doing that I see a single-architecture executable for the simple example of around 14MB (about 11MB for the lib and 3MB for the app code I think).

tensorflow/contrib/makefile/compile_ios_tensorflow.sh "-Os"
body_text:
It has, but one thing I realize I haven't documented well is passing in optimization flags to the build process. After doing that I see a single-architecture executable for the simple example of around 14MB (about 11MB for the lib and 3MB for the app code I think).
tensorflow/contrib/makefile/compile_ios_tensorflow.sh "-Os"
body:
It has, but one thing I realize I haven't documented well is passing in optimization flags to the build process. After doing that I see a single-architecture executable for the simple example of around 14MB (about 11MB for the lib and 3MB for the app code I think).

``` bash
tensorflow/contrib/makefile/compile_ios_tensorflow.sh "-Os"
```
